title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: The streets to the east of Bellevue are built on the site of the village and baronial burgh of Broughton, the name of which is still preserved in Broughton Street, Broughton Place, and Barony Street. The houses to the north of the Bellevue district are built on the lands of Inverleith and Warriston, and form agreeable suburban residences.

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: Drummond Place, also, has the advantage of part of the gardens, and many of the old thorn trees there have attained to a considerable size. The only streets that have retained the name of Bellevue are Bellevue Crescent (looking towards Leith) and Bellevue Terrace, ;it the east end of Claremont Street.

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: The streets to the east of Bellevue are built on the site of the village and baronial burgh of Broughton, the name of which is still preserved in Broughton Street, Broughton Place, and Barony Street. title: Eight journeys abroad /
author: Rosengarten, Mary D. Richardson
snippet: Corinthian columns, much more beautiful than the Bellevue- Stratford room, and lovely flowers on the tables, music playing  outside in the garden, where I should think it was rather cold.

title: The Edinburgh gazetteer, or geographical dictionary ...
snippet: Within the yard there is abrick building of 200 feet by 20, of twostories, containing the work-shops. Thealms-house is situated at Bellevue, on Eastriver, two miles from the city hall. Theprincipal building is of stone, 320 feet by50, of three stories.

title: Sketches of Travel; or, Twelve Months in Europe
author: King, Horatio
snippet: In some parts there are two and inothers three tiers of these little shops. The finestdwelling houses are outside of the village, as is alsothe principal hotel, the Bellevue. Mons.

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: What Lord Jloray's grounds of Drumsheugh were on the west of Queen Street, General Scott's * of Bellevue were on the east. They extended from York Place northwards to Canonmills.

title: Eight journeys abroad /
author: Rosengarten, Mary D. Richardson
snippet: We left in the afternoon of the next day for Brussels Hotel Bellevue, superb, and found Bellamy Storer had left

title: Sketches of travel:
author: King, Horatio
snippet: In some parts there are two and in others three tiers of these little shops. The finest dwelling houses are outside of the village, as is also the principal hotel, the Bellevue. Moiis.

title: Philadelphians abroad.
author: [Conlen, William James]
snippet: We had climbed five thousand feet when we halted for lunch at Andermatt, and we remained but a very short time at the charming Bellevue before we were off again toward the steep slopes of Hospen- thal, passing the many mountain brooks which find their way into the valley from each opposite slope, and getting a fine view of the lofty Spitzberge, over ten thousand feet above sea level.
